name: Black-headed Bulbul
description: It has predominantly greenish plumage, a black head, and a wide band on its tail. Its cheeks are blue. Distinctive features include blue eyes, a yellow tail tip, and the absence of a crest on the head.
spread_note: Southeast Asia, from Bangladesh to Java and Borneo
food_note: Berries and other soft fruits, occasionally insects
reproduction: Females lay 1–3 eggs; incubation data are unknown.
attractions: It stays in small groups of 6–8 individuals. It forages in trees, rarely descending to the ground.
breeding: The first four individuals arrived in 2003 from the wild.
